Description.Name: Better than a Watch
Description.Details: The holovid from the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreQuikscell],company]] headquarters flickers and jitters. A clearly synthesised female voice talks over an image of a speaking, smiling woman whose mouth is very obviously not making the words you hear. "Hello, valued Sales Rep employee! We here at the {TGT_SYSTEM.name} branch of the QUIKSCELL COMPANY thank you for your ERROR years of dedication! As a token of our appreciation for your Sales Rep contribution to the QUIKSCELL COMPANY, we are legally mandat-- thrilled --to reward you with a QUIKSCELL COMPANY CARE PACKAGE! Please enjoy your mandate-- well earned --reward in your own time! Do not use company hours to appreciate the gift. Do not use company hours to inspect the gift. Do not look inside the gift. Do not..." Judging by the scrubber bar, the remaining two-thirds of the message are likely to be legalese. Probably safe to ignore it.

Description.Name: CommanderGearLoot
Description.Details: As you arrive in the 'Mech Bay to inspect the goods - on company time, of course - Yang appears to be midway through the stages of grief. The pile of discarded tools and kicked-over crates of equipment at least tell you he went through anger before you got here. That's good. As you approach, he throws up his hands. "Look, I know we have to work for these guys, but come on!" He starts, incredulous. Perhaps he wasn't quite done with anger yet. "Hey. Just relax, Yang," you say, attempting to reassure him, "it could be worse. They could've just given us a gift card for fifty-percent off [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTripleFBurger],Triple-F]] burgers or something." Wrong move. Yang throws down his plasma torch. "Yeah? I think I would've preferred that, Boss. Enjoy your corporate mandated coffin." As Yang storms off in a huff, you turn your eyes to the 'Mech in the bay.
